title: Cavs blogger says Cleveland should hire Calipari
text:
Cavs blogger says Cleveland should hire Calipari A Cavs blogger says Cleveland should fire Tyronn Lue and hire John Calipari. 
Kentucky coach John Calipari 's name surfacing for NBA job openings has become an annual rite of spring. 
The Cleveland Cavaliers don't even have a job opening and already Calipari's name is being mentioned. 
Quenton Albertie, a Fansided blogger for the Cleveland site King James Gospel , says the Cavs should can coach Tyronn Lue and hire Calipari. 
"While it wonâ€™t happen midseason, in the offseason the Cavs should fire Lue and hire John Calipari," Albertie wrote. 
Albertie has no shortage of grievances with Lue, who coached Cleveland to the NBA championship last season and the No. 1-seed in the East this season. 
Get the latest UK news sent straight to your inbox with out EMAIL NEWSLETTER 
But the Cavaliers, despite one of the most talented rosters in the NBA, have underachieved this season, going just 43-22. 
Albertie cites Calipari's ability to maximize talent, his relationship with Lebron James , his ability to recruit and get high-level players to buy in and his defensive acumen as to why Calipari would be a great fit in Cleveland. 
There was talk back in 2014 that Calipari may have interest in coaching the Cavs, prior to several of his players from Kentucky's 2013-14 Final Four team deciding to come back to school. Cleveland eventually hired David Blatt, who they fired at mid-season during his second year and replaced with Lue. 
In May of 2015, Calipari signed an extension with UK through 2022 which guarantees him $54 million over the next seven seasons. 
His son, Brad, will be a sophomore guard for the Wildcats next season and he also has once again signed the nation's top incoming recruiting class. Author
